title: Conversation Practice
goal: Describe people by their relationships and actions.

sections.content:
Warm-up (2-3 min)

be/bei/be'o review:

be = attaches ?
bei = attaches ?
be'o = ?

(Answers: x2, x3/x4/x5, terminates be-structure)

New Material (5-7 min)

Describing People by Role

A: ti ma
B: ti lo ctuca be la .cmaci.
A: xu ri xamgu
B: .ie ri melbi je certu

(A: What is this? B: This is a teacher of math. A: Is she good? B: Yes, she's beautiful and skilled.)

Asking About Roles

A: do ma
B: mi lo ciska be lo karni
A: be ma
B: be lo skami datni

(A: What are you? B: I'm a writer of journals. A: Of what? B: Of computer data.)

Describing Relationships

A: la .alis. ma
B: ri lo prami be la .bob.
A: xu la .bob. cu djuno
B: mi na djuno

(A: What is Alice? B: She's a lover of Bob. A: Does Bob know? B: I don't know.)

Key Point

Use be/bei naturally in conversation to describe roles and relationships precisely.
sections.title: New Material (5-7 min)

sections.content:
Practice (4-5 min)

Exercise 1: Describe Roles

Translate:

  1. She is a speaker of Lojban.
  2. He is a reader of poems.
  3. They are sellers of books.
Answers
  1. ri lo tavla be la .jbobau.
  2. ri lo tcidu be lo pemci
  3. ri lo vecnu be lo cukta

Exercise 2: Create Dialogues

Write a dialogue about:

  1. Meeting a teacher of languages.
  2. Describing a writer of journals.
Example Answers 
A: do ma
B: mi lo ctuca be lo bangu
A: be ma bangu
B: be la .jbobau. .e la .glibau.

A: ti ma
B: ti lo ciska be lo karni
A: xu ri certu
B: .ie ri certu je xamgu

Exercise 3: Translate

  1. I am a giver of books to children.
  2. Alice is a teacher of math to Bob.
  3. The writer of poems about love is beautiful.
Answers
  1. mi lo dunda be lo cukta bei lo verba
  2. la .alis. cu ctuca be la .cmaci. bei la .bob.
  3. lo ciska be lo pemci be lo prami cu melbi

sections.content:
Conversation Challenge (1-2 min)

Create your own dialogue using:

  • At least one be/bei structure
  • At least two vocabulary words from this week

Example:

A: ti ma
B: ti lo karni be lo datni
A: be ma datni
B: be lo skami
A: xu xamgu
B: .ie xamgu je cnino

(A: What is this? B: This is a journal of data. A: Data about what? B: About computers. A: Is it good? B: Yes, good and new.)

Today's Practice

Conversation patterns:

Pattern Use
lo X be Y The X of Y
be ma Of what?
lo X be Y bei Z The X of Y to Z

Summary

You practiced using be/bei in natural conversation to describe people by their roles and relationships.
